info.name: Job Portal Backend
info.description:
# Documentation

# ðŸ§¾ System Requirements Specification (SRS)

## 1\. Introduction

### 1.1 Purpose

This document defines the functional and non-functional requirements for aÂ **Job Portal Backend System**Â that enablesÂ **users to register**,Â **employers to post jobs**,Â **candidates to apply for jobs**, andÂ **admins to monitor the system**, withÂ **real-time notifications**Â powered byÂ **Socket.io**.

### 1.2 Intended Audience

- Backend Developers
    
- DevOps Engineers
    
- QA Testers
    
- Project Managers
    
- Technical Leads
    

### 1.3 Scope

The backend system will:

- Support user registration & login
    
- Provide role-based access (Admin, Employer, Candidate)
    
- Allow employers to post and manage jobs
    
- Allow candidates to view and apply to jobs
    
- Enable admins to monitor activities
    
- Send real-time notifications for job applications
    

---

## 2\. Overall Description

### 2.1 Product Perspective

This system is the backend of a full-stack Job Portal application. It will expose RESTful APIs and useÂ **MongoDB**Â for storage. Socket.io is used for real-time features. API documentation will be provided via Swagger or Postman.

### 2.2 User Roles

- **Admin**
    
- **Employer**
    
- **Candidate**
    

### 2.3 Assumptions and Dependencies

- The system usesÂ **Node.js + TypeScript**
    
- Database:Â **MongoDB**
    
- Authentication:Â **JWT**
    
- Real-time Communication:Â **Socket.io**
    
- ORM:Â **Mongoose**
    
- Environment: Dockerized
    

---

## 3\. System Features & Requirements

### 3.1 User Authentication

#### Functional Requirements:

- Register and login using email/password
    
- Password hashing usingÂ **bcrypt**
    
- JWT-based authentication
    
- Token expiry configured viaÂ `.env`
    
- Login returns access token
    
- Role is assigned at registration
    

#### Non-functional:

- Secure password storage
    
- Invalid credentials returnÂ `401 Unauthorized`
    

---

### 3.2 Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)

| Route | Access |
| --- | --- |
| POSTÂ `/api/v1/jobs` | Employer only |
| PATCHÂ `/api/v1/jobs/:id` | Employer (Owner) |
| POSTÂ `/api/v1/job-applications` | Candidate only |
| GETÂ `/api/v1/jobs` | All(Employer specific) |

---

### 3.3 Job Management (Employers)

#### Functional Requirements:

- Employers can:
    
    - Create jobs
        
    - Update and delete their own jobs
        
    - View job listings
        
- Job fields:
    
    - `title`Â (required)
        
    - `description`Â (required)
        
    - `companyName`Â (required)
        
    - `location`Â (required)
        
    - `jobType`Â (required)
        
    - `salaryRange`Â (optional)
        
    - `skills`Â (optional)
        
    - `createdBy`Â (required)
        
    - `jobStatus`:Â `Active`Â |Â `Inactive`
        
    - Timestamps:Â `createdAt`,Â `updatedAt`
        

---

### 3.4 Job Viewing (Candidates)

#### Functional Requirements:

- View all jobs
    
- Optional features:
    
    - Pagination
        
    - Search by title, location, keyword
        

---

### 3.5 Job Applications (Candidates)

#### Functional Requirements:

- Apply to jobs
    
- Application fields:
    
    - `jobId`Â (required)
        
    - `candidateId`Â (required)
        
    - `coverLetter`Â (optional)
        
    - `resume`Â (optional)
        
    - `appliedAt`Â (auto-generated)
        

---

### 3.6 Admin Functionalities

#### Functional Requirements:

- View all jobs
    
- View all applications
    
- (Optional) Ban/unban users (soft delete)
    

---

### 3.7 Real-time Notification

#### Functional Requirements:

- Notify employer when a candidate applies
    
- Use Socket.io
    
- Notification includes:
    
    - Job title
        
    - Candidate name (if available)
        
    - Time of application
        

---

## 4\. External Interface Requirements

### 4.1 REST API

- JSON-based HTTP APIs
    
- Uses standard HTTP response codes
    
- Documented via:
    
    - Swagger UI or
        
    - Postman Collection
        

### 4.2 Database

- MongoDB
    
- Mongoose ODM
    
- Collections:
    
    - `users`
        
    - `jobs`
        
    - `applications`
        

### 4.3 Real-time API

- **Socket.io**
    
- Event:Â `job:applied`Â â†’ sent to employer room
    

---

## 5\. Non-functional Requirements

| Requirement | Description |
| --- | --- |
| Security | JWT auth, bcrypt password hashing |
| Performance | Support for pagination & indexed fields |
| Scalability | Dockerized; can scale via container orchestration |
| Reliability | Use of logging (Winston) and error handling |
| Documentation | Postman-based API docs |
| Maintainability | Modular folder structure using clean architecture |
| Portability | Environment-specific config usingÂ `.env` |
| Dev Experience | Hot-reload withÂ `ts-node-dev`, proper linting |

---

## 6\. Environment Setup

### 6.1 Development

- Node.js â‰¥ 16
    
- MongoDB local
    
- Docker + Docker Compose
    
- TypeScript
    
- Tools: Postman, VSCode
    

### 6.2 Production

- Dockerized containers
    
- Env vars loaded fromÂ `.env`
    
- MongoDB Atlas or hosted DB
    

---

## 7\. Deployment Instructions

1. Clone the repo
    
2. CreateÂ `.env`Â file
    
3. docker-compose up --build
    
4. Access API at:Â [http://localhost:5000/api/v1](http://localhost:5000/api/v1)
    

# ðŸ“¦ Entity Definitions

Below is a structured set of entities tailored for theÂ **Job Portal Application**, using consistent naming and relational references.

---

## ðŸ“Œ Role

```
Role {
  id: string;            // e.g., "r_00001"
  title: 'admin' | 'employer' | 'candidate';
}

 ```

## ðŸ“Œ User

```
User {
  id: string;
  role: string;
  email: string;
  password: string;
  createdAt: Date;
  updatedAt: Date;
}

 ```

## ðŸ“Œ Job

```
Job {
  id: string;
  title: string;
  description: string;
  companyName: string;
  location: string;
  jobType: 'full-time' | 'part-time' | 'contract' | 'internship';
  salaryRange?: {
    min: number;
    max: number;
  };
  skills?: string[];
  createdBy: string;     // FK to User.id
  jobStatus: 'Active' | 'Inactive';
  createdAt: Date;
  updatedAt: Date;
}

 ```

## ðŸ“Œ JobApplication

```
JobApplication {
  id: string;
  jobId: string;         // FK to Job.id
  candidateId: string;   // FK to User.id
  coverLetter?: string;
  resume?: string;
  appliedAt: Date;
}

 ```

## ðŸ“Œ Notification

```
Notification {
  id: string;
  recipientId: string;   // FK to User.id (employer)
  jobId: string;         // FK to Job.id
  message: string;
  read: boolean;
  createdAt: Date;
}

 ```

# ðŸ”Œ API Endpoints â€“ Job Portal Backend System

---

## ðŸ§¾ Auth

### ðŸ§‘â€ðŸ’¼ Register New User

- **Method:**Â POST
    
- **Access:**Â Public (Verified)
    
- **Description:**Â Create a new user account
    
- **Path:**Â `/auth/register`
    
- **Request Body:**
    
    - `name`
        
    - `email`
        
    - `password`
        
    - `roles`Â array (enum: admin | employer | candidate) â€” default: candidate
        
- **Responses:**
    
    - **201**
        
        - `statusCode`
            
        - `status`
            
        - `message`
            
        - `data`: {Â `access_token`Â }
            
    - **400 | 500**
        
        - `statusCode`
            
        - `status`
            
        - `message`
            

---

### ðŸ” Login

- **Method:**Â POST
    
- **Access:**Â Public
    
- **Description:**Â Login using credentials
    
- **Path:**Â `/auth/login`
    
- **Request Body:**
    
    - `email`
        
    - `password`
        
- **Responses:**
    
    - **200**
        
        - `statusCode`
            
        - `status`
            
        - `message`
            
        - `data`: {Â `access_token`Â }
            
    - **400 | 404 | 500**
        
        - `statusCode`
            
        - `status`
            
        - `message`
            

---

## ðŸ“„ Job

### âž• Create Job Post

- **Method:**Â POST
    
- **Access:**Â Private (employer)
    
- **Path:**Â `/jobs`
    
- **Request Body:**
    
    - `title\*`
        
    - `description\*`
        
    - `companyName\*`
        
    - `location\*`
        
    - `jobType\*`
        
    - `salaryRange`Â (min, max)
        
    - `skills`
        
- **Responses:**
    
    - **201**
        
    - **400 | 500**
        

---

### ðŸ“¥ List All Jobs

- **Method:**Â GET
    
- **Access:**Â Public
    
- **Path:**Â `/jobs`
    
- **Query:**
    
    - `page`
        
    - `limit`
        
    - `search`
        
    - `location`
        
    - `jobType`
        
- **Responses:**
    
    - **200**: List of jobs
        
    - **404 | 500**
        

---

### ðŸ” Get Single Job

- **Method:**Â GET
    
- **Access:**Â Public
    
- **Path:**Â `/jobs/{id}`
    
- **Responses:**
    
    - **200**
        
    - **404 | 500**
        

---

### âœï¸ Update Job

- **Method:**Â PATCH
    
- **Access:**Â Private (employer)
    
- **Path:**Â `/jobs/{id}`
    
- **Request Body:**
    
    - Any editable job fields
        
- **Responses:**
    
    - **200 | 400 | 404 | 500**
        

---

### âŒ Delete Job

- **Method:**Â DELETE
    
- **Access:**Â Private (employer)
    
- **Path:**Â `/jobs/{id}`
    
- **Responses:**
    
    - **204 | 404 | 500**
        

---

## ðŸ§¾ Job Application

### ðŸ“¬ Apply to Job

- **Method:**Â POST
    
- **Access:**Â Private (candidate)
    
- **Path:**Â `/job-applications`
    
- **Request Body:**
    
    - `jobId\*`
        
    - `coverLetter`
        
    - `resume`
        
- **Responses:**
    
    - **201**
        
    - **400 | 404 | 500**
        

### ðŸ“„ View Job Applications

- **Method:**Â GET
    
- **Access:**Â Private (admin)
    
- **Path:**Â `/job-applications`
    
- **Responses:**
    
    - **200 | 404 | 500**
        

---

## ðŸ”” Notifications (Socket.io)

> <p >Real-time notifications are pushed via Socket.io to employers when a candidate applies to a job.</p> 
  

**Event:**Â **`job:applied`**  
**Payload:**

```
{
	"recipientId": "_uniqueId",
	"jobId": "_uniqueId",
	"message": "New application for Frontend Developer"
}q

 ```
